column4: It's running the TCP/IP NetBIOS service and I've disabled windows share security, even.
what's up?
I can't connect to an Ubuntu samba server from a Windows 7 client, and so far none of the Ubuntu documentation I've found has helped
i see, what's your config?
1 min, I'll pastebin it
http://pastebin.com/dmz7y6Mb
are you trying to browse to them from the windows 7 client as \\IP\x$ or \\IP\x where x = w,x,y,z ?
workgroup is definitely "WORKGROUP" yeah?
try installing samba-common and samba-tools
so were you saying before that you can't run "/etc/init.d/samba restart" ?
Correct, the right command is "smbd restart" (the guide is out of date)
hrmm pretty sure it works for me
i take it the /media/x folders exist and your user has permissions on them?
Viking667 scriptwarlock violinappren: Thank you all for your attention, but I doubt that this can be solved without loads of trouble
hrmm, i take it you can ping each machine? what does win7 error with?
instantaneous or after a delay?
sounds like either samba's not running or it's not able to connect to the ports properly
Do you know how I can check if it's connecting to the ports properly?
i would look up the default ports then nmap scan the sharing ubuntu box from the windows box
you weren't trying to browse to the shares with a hostname were you?
use the syntax "nmap -sS <IP>"
did you have a server running a different OS on that IP address before?
